results.title: Working from home
results.brief_description: Outlines the practical steps involved in launching and running your own home business. You will receive vital tips on how to avoid common pitfalls, and how to reach your potential faster. Topics covered include: why home business is booming, the benefits and disadvantages, what type of business can be run from home, launching your home business, managing your business - and yourself, what happens if you are sick, and much more. Presented by Charles Weyman.

results.title: Working elephants of Siam
results.brief_description: Provides a study of the teak industry in the tropical uplands of Thailand. Shows elephants hauling and lifting the teak logs in the forests and swimming in the river in the evening.

results.title: Working and playing to health
results.brief_description: Shows the programs of recreational, occupational and industrial therapy for the patients of a mental hospital. Explains why and how these techniques are used to bring patients back to health.

results.title: Workers' compensation and its effectiveness. "On compo": workers' compensation in Victoria
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Education Dept. Audio-Visual Resources Branch
results.brief_description: Two programs which address the issue of workers’ compensation in Victoria. In the first program Noel Norton chairs a discussion between Ian Spicer, Ken Stone and Mark Esler on the aspects of concern to them. The second program gives an overview of how workers’ compensation works in Victoria, the legislative and administrative processes involved, and its advantages and disadvantages.

results.title: Workcover: a comprehensive video guide
results.creator_credit: Kingwest Productions, Video Master, Dieter Vornhagen and Steven King
results.brief_description: Andrew Ellis, solicitor, discusses the individual’s rights to compensation for work related injuries. Topics include: the role of the solicitor; making a claim for compensation; lump sums for permanent disability; the role of the courts and dispute settlement. This program is intended as a starting point, not as a replacement for expert legal advice.

results.title: Work study: work measurement, basic principles
results.creator_credit: Anvil Films and British Productivity Council
results.brief_description: An examination of time study, as a work measurement technique. The importance of rating and the less direct methods of deriving standard times - analysis and synthesis (including Predetermined Motion Time Standards) are considered. Shows a manufacturer faced with the problem of a particularly large order.

results.title: Work study: its application to teamwork
results.brief_description: How the analytical techniques of Work Study can be used to improve operations carried out by more than one person. Emphasises the need for good communications and for having the men concerned take part in groups discussions where criticism and suggestions can be fully voiced. Shows the original conditions in a galvanising shop, the identification of improvement needed and how they were adopted co-operatively. Touches on problems of redundancy.

results.title: Work Study: an introduction
results.brief_description: The aim of all Work Study in its application is to increase productivity. By providing the accurate standard time data that management requires on methods, planning and costing of work in a disciplined way, work study leads to higher productivity.

results.title: Work study practical exercise film. No. 12
results.brief_description: An analysis of poultry feeding and egg collection designed to help work study lecturers; each operation requiring special study skills and techniques. The first part is a complete record of the original methods filmed as would be seen by a work study engineer. The film is stopped and students carry out their studies. Then the second part of the film shows the actions installed is projected. Part of the “Work Study Case Histories - No 2”.

results.title: Work study in printing
results.creator_credit: Napier Films, Leon Clore and Sam Napier-Bell
results.brief_description: The introduction of work study to a typical medium sized printing firm, handicapped by lack of space and shows how work study can help to combat rising costs and improve productivity. Emphasis is on need for consultation between management and the chapels throughout the exercise. Method study and work measurement are explained. Specific examples demonstrate the advantages of applying work study to every branch of the industry.
